alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 10:14PM EST until February 05 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County. .Steady rains from Thursday will continue to cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enter yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM EST Thursday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 19.3 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by Friday morning.
